1. (S) Tactical Situation:
What follow are orders from Severnyy Flot codenamed Operation 'Hidden Lillies'. Your submarines K-503, an Oscar 1 class SSGN, and K-244, a Victor 3 class SSN are to meet at designated point with "Volkhov" submarine tender ship and it's escort to conduct at sea replenishment.
Then you are to lay down in the designated area to await passage of enemy convoy. We believe the convoy is lacking in ASW protection and consists of several HVT units.
In what is estimated as 20 minutes a flight of Tu-95RTs will pass near the area of operation to gather further data and help us clarify the picture. The information will be shared with you via secure links as fast as possible.
South of the randezvous position operates "Barometr" Okean class spy ship. Furthermore not to raise suspiction Patrol Group "Curtain" has been recalled to position further east. If need be use it to your adventage.
We know for a fact the enemy submarines are not operating this side of Svalbard at the moment.
2. (S) Primary Objective:
Attack US Navy convoy passing north of Svalbard. Focus your efforts on HTV targets like landing ships and fleet auxiliaries.
3. (S) Threat Report:
It is assessed as unlikely that target convoy will be screened by ASW warships. Still you are required to positively identify any and all contacts you come upon.
It is assessed as highly likely that enemy AWACS platform will conduct routine flyover south of your position. We know the schedules and track the flights constantly, those are not to worry about.
NATO submarines are not anticipated to be a threat on the northern side of Svalbard. We have intel on one or two submarines south-west of your area of operations. It is assessed as higly likely that the enemy convoy is being followed by smaller group. Those vessels are considered secondary targets..
(S) EMCON - Maintain radio silence until otherwise directed. AGI unit in the area operates under it's own discretion.
